I'm trying to understand the SoftwareVersionCache a bit. Please correct me if mistaken:
1. It keeps the latest version of all know bundles in memory (SoftwareVersionCacheItems)
2. Each of them contains the full feature.xml + properties + a bit of data added by hibernate
3. The SoftwareVersionCache is used by the SoftwareResolver when trying to resolve a profile

Regards,
Elias.

To fix this you can just change the amount of memory allocated to the server. 
When a call is made to the SoftwareVersionCache it caches the latest software in memory allowing for faster resolution of a profile but inturn needs more memory allocated.

But yes that is correct as to the functionality of the SoftwareVersionCache.

I've updated the SoftwareVersionCache to use a different intermediary format that uses less space and improves the performance of the resolution.  The server is still optimized to load the software entries into memory and it still remains a potential optimization to change the server to have a lazy cache or some other mechanism to use the resolver in a more efficient way.
